goldenNuggets.topic: Claude Code vs Cursor vs Codex
goldenNuggets.content: Claude Code is the best product for coding agents, Codex is the best model, and Google's Anti-Gravity is the new competitor targeting Cursor
Don't build habits on any single AI coding tool. Practice switching between Claude Code, Codex, and Anti-Gravity to remain flexible
It's easier to switch from mobile to desktop than desktop to mobile due to screen real estate constraints. Start with mobile as a forcing function
Red files = need to be added (git add), Green files = staged for commit (git commit), 'Nothing to commit' = ready to push
Plan to ship next week 'ready or not' - better to get real user feedback than perfect the product in isolation
Becoming a senior developer without working as one - knowing what to ask for and pushing back against AI when needed
With AI tools, someone with zero coding background can build production apps in weeks - paradigm shift in development
Google is targeting Cursor with Anti-Gravity rather than Claude Code and Codex directly, aiming for both consumers and developers
Google made $110 billion this year, has TPUs (doesn't need Nvidia GPUs), and has a legion of ML programmers - positioned to dominate
The proper workflow is: make all edits locally, test them, then deploy to production (e.g., Digital Ocean)
WebSockets create a real-time connection between server and client, essential for live features like transcription during recording
DNS (Domain Name Service) translates human-readable domains to computer-readable numbers, fundamental to internet infrastructure
DKIM records are public keys used to verify email signature authenticity, required for sending from verified domains
Always run 'git status' first to check where you are. Senior developers don't use coding agents for git commits
Command+K in Cursor is for atomic changes within a page. Command+L (or Command+I) opens the agent for codebase-wide conversations
Build logging into the backend to catch errors and debug issues, especially important when moving from prototype to production
Give first users free access, then offer first 100 users 50% discount ($25-50 range) to build initial user base
Talking to users is more important than competitions, though competitions can improve public speaking
Use prompt engineering to narrow down the planning phase as much as possible before executing any code
Resend email service has a testing mode that only sends to your own email address - must configure DNS for production
Email sending domain must match website domain for proper authentication and to avoid being marked as spam
Ask questions constantly of AI and have it ask you questions until you're sure the image in its head matches yours
OpenCode is the open-source version that allows plugging in Chinese models, offering more programmability for advanced users
Digital real estate refers to the limited space on screens, especially mobile. Designing for smaller screens forces better prioritization
Use Pavlovian associations in design - e.g., associating 'salvada vida' (saved life) with brand colors to create psychological connections
Implement install prompts on mobile web to encourage users to add the app to their home screen for better engagement
Docker containers help manage different deployment targets (mobile vs desktop) with consistent environments
Email was originally decentralized until Gmail centralized it through better spam filtering and search monopoly
Memorize frequently used commands (like npm run dev) to stay in flow state rather than constantly searching for them
LM Studio is the first step for running ML models locally, essential for ML development on powerful machines
Mesh networks are peer-to-peer connections that enable internet without centralized servers, useful for disaster scenarios
There's a difference between marketing emails and spam. Always aim for marketing angle with proper authentication
Development follows the scientific method - hypothesis, test, iterate. Comes from Popper and Thomas Kuhn's work (1700s-1900s)
Polite disagreement is essential because we all have different perspectives. Watch out for disagreement as power plays
SOAP notes are a standardized way for doctors to organize patient information during recordings
Create a modular digital command center for doctors online, equivalent to their physical office utilities
Legacy systems are black and white without giving users freedom to organize - opportunity for modern solutions
Resend offers both transactional emails and broadcast/campaign features for marketing communications
OpenAI has best product sense but is losing money. Anthropic is more efficiency-minded. Both face pressure from Google
The AI landscape is heading toward Google vs China, with Chinese open-source models improving rapidly
Gemini 3 is available as a command-line terminal agent through beta signup, competing with Claude Code
Extended periods of focused development ('been in flow' for weeks) lead to rapid progress and completion
MacBook Pro with M4 Max chip and 128GB RAM is suitable for developing ML models locally
ESP32 can connect to mesh networks in cities, enabling communication during power outages (cypherpunk prepper approach)
Raspberry Pi can be used for practical IoT projects like counting potatoes on conveyor belts using connected cameras
Buenos Aires is the crypto capital of the world for creativity and builders, surpassing San Francisco, Singapore, and Dubai
Rootstock (Bitcoin layer 2 side chain for DeFi) and many other crypto protocols were created by Argentines
QuickTime can share iPhone screens on Zoom through File > New Movie Recording and selecting iPhone from dropdown
Pork Bun is a domain registrar that provides DNS management and email hosting configuration
Google's UI is like a crypt - arcane and hard to navigate due to billions of users and many edge cases (same for AWS, Microsoft)
